question.title: Alternative to setXORMode in Java for reversible graphics?
question.body:
Is there an alternative to setXORMode in Java to do reversible graphics? I need to draw lines or rectangles, then redraw over them to undo them. AlphaComposite.Xor doesn't do it. A full repaint while the user is dragging a line/rectangle would be possible but painful.

Motivation: I'm plagued by the huge performance hit after using setXORMode reported by Wolf a while back (Java2D performance issue after using setXORMode(Color c)). The problem isn't the performance of the XORMode itself; it's that a single call to setXORMode corrupts something, such that subsequent graphics calls remain achingly slow for the lifetime of the component. (Only in Windows; macOS no problem.)

[using Windows 11, Oracle JDK24]
